Package net.royalur.notation

Class RGN<P extends Piece,S extends PlayerState,R extends Roll>

java.lang.Object
net.royalur.notation.RGN<P,S,R>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Notation<P,S,R>
public class RGN<P extends Piece,S extends PlayerState,R extends Roll> extends Object implements Notation<P,S,R>
RGN (Royal Game Notation) is a textual format to encode games of the Royal Game of Ur. The notation is intended to be readable by both humans and machines. This notation is inspired by Chess' PGN (Portable Game Notation).

RGN was developed by Padraig Lamont with help from several contributors from the Royal Game of Ur Discord server: Diego Raposo, Monomino, Sachertorte, kapfab, and Raph.

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT_MAX_ACTION_LINE_LENGTH

      public static final int DEFAULT_MAX_ACTION_LINE_LENGTH
      The default maximum length for lines in RGN that encode the actions taken in a game.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT_MAX_TURN_LINE_LENGTH

      public static final int DEFAULT_MAX_TURN_LINE_LENGTH
      The default maximum length of each line representing a turn in RGN. A single turn can exceed the max action line length, in which case it will be placed on its own line.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • RGN

      public RGN(@Nonnull NameMap<?,? extends PathPairFactory> pathPairs, @Nonnull NameMap<?,? extends BoardShapeFactory> boardShapes, int maxActionLineLength, int maxTurnLineLength)
      Instantiates the RGN notation to encode and decode games.
      Parameters:
      pathPairs - The paths that can be parsed in this notation.
      boardShapes - The board shapes that can be parsed in this notation.
      maxActionLineLength - The maximum length of the lines that contain moves.
      maxTurnLineLength - The maximum length of a turn before it is split onto another line.

    • appendDiceRoll

      protected <P extends Piece, S extends PlayerState, R extends Roll> void appendDiceRoll(@Nonnull RuleSet<P,S,R> rules, @Nonnull StringBuilder builder, @Nonnull RolledGameState<P,S,R> rolledState)
      Encodes the dice roll from rolledState into builder.
      Type Parameters:
      P - The type of pieces that exist on the board in the given state.
      S - The type of the player state that is stored in the given state.
      R - The type of the dice rolls that was made in the given state.
      Parameters:
      rules - The rules of the game in which the dice are being encoded.
      builder - The builder into which to append the encoded dice roll.
      rolledState - The state of the game that contains the dice roll to encode.

    • appendMove

      protected <P extends Piece, S extends PlayerState, R extends Roll> void appendMove(@Nonnull RuleSet<P,S,R> rules, @Nonnull StringBuilder builder, @Nonnull MovedGameState<P,S,R> movedState)
      Encodes the move from movedState into builder.
      Type Parameters:
      P - The type of pieces that exist on the board in the given state.
      S - The type of the player state that is stored in the given state.
      R - The type of the dice rolls that was used in the given state.
      Parameters:
      rules - The rules of the game in which the dice are being encoded.
      builder - The builder into which to append the encoded move.
      movedState - The state of the game that contains the move to encode.
